meanings.definition: To cut off the mane or tail of (a horse) so that it stands up in a stiff brush.
meanings.sent1: She roached the horse's mane before the competition.
meanings.sent2: The groom roached the horse's tail neatly.
meanings.sent3: The horse looked surprised after being roached by the groom.
meanings.sent4: The roached mane made the horse look like a proud lion.
meanings.sent5: The roached tail made the horse look unique among the others.

meanings.definition: To roll or curl (the edge of a piece of paper, for example) in a curve.
meanings.sent1: He roached the paper's edge to give it a fancy look.
meanings.sent2: She roached the invitation card for the party.
meanings.sent3: The roached paper edge added a touch of elegance to the project.
meanings.sent4: The roached edge of the paper resembled a gentle wave.
meanings.sent5: The roached edge made the paper stand out from the rest.
